History of the Stock Market

  1. Dashboard
  2. History of the Stock Market

The stock market is a physical or digital place where investors can buy and sell stock (shares) in publicly traded companies . The price of these shares is driven by supply and demand. The more shares that people want to buy, the higher the price goes.
The modern stock market was created in Amsterdam where the Dutch East India Company was the first publicly traded company. They decided to raise capital by selling stock and paying dividends of the shares to investors.
The Nasdaq is referring to the Nasdaq Composite Index, which, like the Dow Jones Industrial Average, is a statistical measure of a portion of the stock market. Both the Dow and the Nasdaq are terms that refer to an index, or an average of many values derived from price movements of certain stocks.
